events.name: Discussing Marx´ Capital: on Primitive Accumulation and the State
events.description:
Karl Marx was born 200 years ago this May. A few weeks ago we discussed part of William Clare Roberts' recent book "Marx' Inferno". We discussed the notions of force and fraud under capitalism (chapters 4 and 5 of Roberts´ book). On this occasion the proposed reading is directly from Marx' "Capital": part 8 of volume 1 of Capital entitled "Primitive Accumulation", which is only 35 pages. This event is standalone, no need to have attended any previous meetup. The text of Capital is freely available here: https://www.marxists.org/archive/marx/works/1867-c1/index.htm

Those who want can have the accompanying read of Roberts chapter 6 (and 7, the conclusion). To be investigated is the notion of primitive accumulation but this could be supplemented during our time together with a discussion of the state under capitalism (role in expropriation, legislation, industrialization, colonialism). We could perhaps conclude our session placing our own understanding of primitive accumulation as well as the state today with what we find with Marx directly, getting inspiration from Roberts' book or any other secondary literature/sources you might know of. All suggestions are welcome.

Other materials:
Marx is making somewhat of a comeback (as a body of thought or as a boogeyman; Marxism is dead). Here is a two part series discussing "Marx on the internet"

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l5c4vrXKtiI
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SUY_zEkVz88

In a way these videos can serve as a little follow-up or reminder or our previous discussion as we discussed Marx desire to critique other socialist thinkers who perhaps wanted a different distribution of social goods but were unwilling to "go through capitalism and come out the other side". I mention here Zero Books (see the above video links) and Mark Fisher's book Capitalist Realism. It's a Jameson/Zizek inspired take on capitalism being so dominant that no alternatives can even be conceived. As we discussed about Marx' desire to "go through" capitalism, here we see an argument that there is (no longer?) any way out the other side through the giant's ass at the bottom of Hell.

From wikipedia: "As a philosophical concept, capitalist realism is influenced by the Althusserian conception of ideology, as well as the work of Fredric Jameson and Slavoj Žižek. Fisher proposes that within a capitalist framework there is no space to conceive of alternative forms of social structures, adding that younger generations are not even concerned with recognizing alternatives. He proposes that the 2008 financial crisis compounded this position; rather than catalyzing a desire to seek alternatives for the existing model, the response to the crisis reinforced the notion that modifications must be made within the existing system. Fisher argues that capitalist realism has propagated a 'business ontology' which concludes that everything should be run as a business including education and healthcare."

About "Marx' Inferno":
Marx's Inferno reconstructs the major arguments of Karl Marx's Capital and inaugurates a completely new reading of a seminal classic. Rather than simply a critique of classical political economy, William Roberts argues that Capital was primarily a careful engagement with the motives and aims of the workers' movement. Understood in this light, Capital emerges as a profound work of political theory. Placing Marx against the background of nineteenth-century socialism, Roberts shows how Capital was ingeniously modeled on Dante's Inferno, and how Marx, playing the role of Virgil for the proletariat, introduced partisans of workers' emancipation to the secret depths of the modern -social Hell.- In this manner, Marx revised republican ideas of freedom in response to the rise of capitalism.
(https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/30009123-marx-s-inferno)

events.name: Grand Debate- Bring the Tech Giants to heel!
events.description:
Google, Apple, Facebook, Amazon; A quadriga of companies that, more than any others, have pulled capitalism into the information age. You know them- they changed the way you spoke to your friends, found information, bought clothes and books, and more...their influence (and that of their peers) on how we live now can hardly be over-estimated.

Many benefits- but at a fearsome price. Are we more isolated now, more prone to envy fuelled mental disorders, are our elections less free? Have a handful of private enterprises unwittingly reversed the tide of progress towards peace and a liberal world order in just a few decades? Or are these old problems, simply raising their heads after a lull in the storm?

And even if tech companies are unduly influential- do governments have the capacity (let alone the will) to do something about it? Anyone who witnessed the blunt savaging that one CEO recently received at the hands of a few legislators may well wonder if the problem lies with bad tech, or bad politicians.

It's a topic worth debating. Join us then on July 4th as our proposition argues that "This House believes governments should do more to limit the power of tech companies'

Speaking time is 10 minutes per speaker, 4 speakers per team. to register your interest, please pick a team via the comments below. First come first serve!

Peter

The international AfterWork is a social gathering where people are meeting, socialising, making new friends and just having a nice conversation/chat after a hard-working day. Nothing is better than having a random conversation with like-minded attendees :) You can come alone or accompanied by friends. Do not be surprised if you see others inviting you to join their conversation, the event is all about that :=)

The event is informal, no need to leave your Business card at the entrance or register/pay for the entree, it's totally free of charge.

The new venue will be reserved only for us. All the attendees w...ill be gathering for the same purpose - chill and have a nice chat. The event usually ends up with nice encounters and interesting new friends. Our hosts will be welcoming and make sure you get the best out of it.

ONE MORE THING:: Click 'going' to get updated will all the upcoming information ;)

- Where? Mezzo bar, Borgval 18, 1000 Brussels
- Happy hour from 6 to 10p.m on spirits and cocktails
- Photoshooting by BrunoMaes.net (http://brunomaes.net/)

Please RSVP to get updated of further information.

Kind regards

Adam

events.name: Info sessie 'Ubuntu Circles' - Organiseren naar veerkracht
events.description:
Ben jij een organisatieleider die de juiste context wil creëren om het potentieel van je organisatie maximaal te laten realiseren? Besef je dat dit vraagt om een trendbreuk en een innovatieve en authentieke aanpak die de klassieke organisatiemodellen vervangt door een gedeelde zingeving , self-leadership, anders samenwerken en de volle inzet van goesting en talent?
Zoek jij ook partners om die zoektocht naar andere paradigma’s te verdiepen of te versnellen?
Heb jij zin om hierover in verbinding te gaan en samen met anderen te leren ? Kom dan even kennismaken en zien of de Ubuntu Circles iets voor uw organisatie kan betekenen.

events.name: Dandelion debate night: Vegetarianism

venue.name: Café de Markten
venue.address_1: Rue du Vieux Marché aux Grains 5

events.description:
Are vegetarians denying their true natures? Are they obsessed with ridiculing and demonising meat eaters? Or should we have progressed beyond eating meat? Is eating meat ultimately uncivilised and unnecessary? Sharpen your pencils, carrots and sticks for the next debate.

Debating involves one topic and two sides making their case. The host draws the teams at random and provides feedback afterwards because our goal is not only that you learn something about vegetarianism but also communication.

There is no need to prepare anything in advance but bringing pen and paper does not hurt.

The Dandelion debate nights argue one topic and train one technique each week. It takes place at a venue fully accessible for wheelchair users.

All levels of experience are very welcome - from first-timers to experienced debaters. Practice public speaking with fun!

www.thedandeliongroup.eu
events.how_to_find_us: You will find us in the bar at the long table behind the black curtain. If you do not spot us immediately, just ask one of the kind waitresses.

events.name: Do you need to improve your public  speaking skills?
events.description:
Did you know, fear of public speaking inhibits promotion to management by 15% and cuts salaries by 10% ? Overcome your fear and learn valuable leadership skills at our next meeting on 7th June. Everyone welcome!

Claddagh Toastmaster Members are now able to participate in a new international educational programme called Pathways tailor made to meet the needs of the member.
Members and Guests will have an opportunity to learn more about this exciting public speaking and leadership programme. Admission Free. Where else would you get an innovative training programme with all the options below like this in Brussels??

Motivational Strategies

Presentation Mastery

1. Leadership Development

2. Innovative Planning

3. Visionary Communication

4. Strategic Relationships

5. Dynamic Leadership

6. Persuasive Influence

7. Effective Coaching

8. Team Collaboration

You are invited to Claddagh Toastmasters, guests are most welcome and bring a friend if you wish. Admission Free.

We meet on Thursday 21 June, 2018 at 7:00 PM to 9:15pm - Welcome coffee at 6.45pm
Please note our new venue:

Co-working & Meeting Rooms Centre,
The Mug
Rue Charles Martel 8, Brussels 1000,

(Near Schuman(Berlaymont exit) & Maelbeek Metro stops) Known as ´The Mug´. It is one minute´s walk from the Meeting Point Pub & restaurant on Rue Taciturne)

CLADDAGH ENGLISH/IRISH TOASTMASTERS CLUB OF BRUSSELS TOASTMASTER AN CHLADAIGH – CLUB DÁTHEANGACH NA BRUISÉILE

Claddagh Toastmasters helps you to develop your skills in public speaking, planning, leadership training, and managing your time. They aim is to provide a fun and social environment in which to practice your skills.

Please let them know you are coming by reserving your place to [masked].

Claddagh Toastmasters are a club with an Irish Flair with a membership from about ten different nationalities. English is mainly spoken at the meeting but there is an opportunity for Irish speakers to speak in Irish (second oldest spoken language in Europe).

You are most welcome to join us as a guest for this 'demonstration meeting' at no cost to see how the club works. Guests will be be asked for a short introduction at the start of the meeting and for their feedback at the end of the meeting. During the meeting there is a coffee break where you can network and discuss the training programme with members. You will also be invited to make a small contribution towards the cost of the teas,coffees and cookies.

Come and experience it for yourself!

The ultimate objective of the meeting is to emphasise how communication and planning can play an important role in the home and work place and how Toastmasters is an ideal organisation to serve all generations to help you plan and enjoy an active life.

Last thing (finally !!!): the first part of the meeting will be held as usual with Table Topics and impromptu speeches and second part consists of prepared speeches given by members in accordance with set objectives followed by evaluations to improve .There is no obligation for guests to speak unless they agree to do so. Afterwards guests can decide if you want to become a member or come back again for a second meeting as a guest.

email: [masked], to confirm your place. Claddagh Toastmasters meet at the Co-working & Meeting Rooms Centre,

Rue Charles Martel 8, Brussels 1000, on the first and third Thursday of the month. Welcome coffee at 6.45 pm. Meeting starts at 7pm sharp. You ring the designated Toastmasters bell to gain entry.

They then go a local pub afterwards for a social and networking drink......this is optional...

http://www.toastmasters.org

venue.name: Coffee House Aksum, galerie du roi ,3

events.description: Bring your projects and we'll talk about them....

events.name: Le Vieux qui lisait des romans d'amour
events.description: Est le premier romain du chilien Luís Sepúlveda, qui a eu un retentissement extraordinaire lors de sa sortie en 1989 et fut traduit la même année en français puis dans 14 autres langues. La genèse de cette oeuvre littéraire a débuté dix ans plus tôt en Equateur, lors que l’auteur fut surpris un jour au coeur de la forêt amazonienne par un épouvantable orage, et se réfugiât avec ses compagnons amérindiens dans une hutte habitée par un blanc d'un certain âge. De cette rencontre sylvestre, particulièrement conviviale, est né Le vieux qui lisait des romans d'amour et dont j’espère vous donnera envier d’en discuter lors de notre prochaine rencontre.

events.name: Irish Dancing Classes in Brussels
events.description:
Irish Dancing Class - Every Second Thursday in Brussels
Children & Adult Classes.

The Irish in Europe Association welcome to Brussels

The Newe Academy of Irish Dance

Aisling Newe grew up in Tipperary, Ireland. She started dancing at the age of 4 and throughout her dancing career has competed in many competitions around the world. Aisling has also toured with the ‘Echoes of Eireann’ group. In 2014, Aisling took her T.C.R.G exam and successfully passed with honors making her a fully qualified Irish Dance teacher. She has a passion and love for the dance form and is excited to be embarking on this new venture in Brussels.

The Newe Academy of Irish Dance was launched in Brussels on 29th September 2016

The 2018 Classes are as follows:

Feb 8th,22nd
Mar 1st,8th,15th,22nd,29th
Apr 19th,26th
May 3rd,17th,24th,31st
June 7th,14th,21st.
at Fred Academy,

Rue de la Révolution 18,
1000 Bruxelles, Belgium

Alain

events.name: Query Folding and combining Google Forms with SSRS and Power BI
events.description:
--- Description ---
This evening we'll first take a dive into query folding. This very important but often overlooked feature can make or break the data refresh for your reports. Nicky van Vroenhoven will guide us through the what, how and why of query folding.
Next up is Indira Bandari, speaker at SQL Saturday conferences and an impressive career of already 15 years in BI. She'll be guiding us through an innovative solution she build, combining Google Forms, SSRS and Power BI. This is a session that was also recently selected at a SQL Saturday, so really a must see!

--- Agenda ---
• 18:00 - 18:30 - Free food & drinks, sponsored by Microsoft
• 18:30 - 19:30 - Query folding in Power BI
• 19:30 - 19:35 - Break
• 19:35 - 20:40 - (remote) Google Forms meet Power BI via Reporting Services (SSRS)
• 20:40 - ??:?? - Drinks, discussions and fun

--- Session 1 ---
* Query folding in Power BI *

Power Query allows you to extract and transform data from a variety of data sources. Have you ever noticed that the importing of data is slower than you expected? In most of those cases, query folding is not happening. Query folding is very important because it offloads data transformations to the source instead of doing them in Power BI. Come learn how you can ensure you get all the performance improvements possible for your reports! As a bonus, you'll also learn when query folding is not your best friend.

Speaker: Nicky van Vroenhoven
(https://twitter.com/NickyvV)
(https://www.nickyvv.com)
Nicky van Vroenhoven is a BI professional focused at the Microsoft stack. He mainly works with SSIS, Biml, T-SQL development and Power BI. After working 8 years in several BI-consultancy jobs in many industries and companies, he is currently working as a Senior BI Developer at the DWH team at Van Lanschot Kempen. In addition he enjoys tweeting, and blogging on http://NickyvV.com about topics like Power BI, DAX and SQL Server in general.

--- Session 2 - Remote Speaker ---
* Google Forms meet Power BI via Reporting Services (SSRS)*

Are you interested in getting to know what your customers are thinking about your services? Empower your business with this end to end solution of creating feedback survey, sending and receving the responses and then finally analysing the same.

In this session I will show you how to
• Initiate customer feedback surveys using Google Forms.
• Send the survey emails to the database contacts through data driven subscriptions of Reporting
Services (SSRS)
• And finally analyse the customer feedback using Power BI

Speaker: Indira Bandari
(https://twitter.com/indupriya9)
(http://mytechlearning.blogspot.co.nz/)
Business Intelligence Consultant with over 15 years experience in designing and developing datawarehouses and analytical solutions. I have a Masters degree in Statistics and am passionate in learning data science. Volunteering and sharing my knowledge is my passion. I am a speaker at the local User Group and SQL Saturday sessions in New Zealand
In my pass time I teach game development for primary school kids.
